Deficiency Narrative: A child's record did not contain plans or contact information for their siblings.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a compliance plan by email. Operation states that all shelter team leads, direct care workers, behavioral support staff, campus manager have been provided with training concerning the need to have youth in care siblings contact information documented. Each type of intake has been visited on how at intake sibling information will be collected for DFPS, RHY and BCJP youth. Upper management will also continuously check on this moving forward and has stressed this fact with the overnight staff who do the majority of the RHY intakes.

Deficiency Narrative: The incident report only had the names of two of the staff involved. There were others not listed.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a compliance plan by email. Operation has taken corrective action by completing a staffing with lead staff to review requirements for serious incident reports. This information was then disseminated down to all staff.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that one childs prescribe medication was administered to another child.
Correction Narrative:
Email: Operation provided a corrective action plan on 02/24/2025. Staff that incorrectly administered medication has been placed on supervised medication administration until end of March 2025. Team leader, program or campus manager or nurse will supervise this staff member during medication duties. All staff will be provided with additional medication management training. Staff on duty and responsible for medication error will meet with nurse within 24 hours to discuss error and complete report/documentation. The error report will be completed before staff leaves shift. 

Inspection: An inspection was completed at the operation on 03/19/2025. One staff and one child was interviewed and medication logs were reviewed. No concerns were found during this inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: A medication error report was not completed within 24 hours.
Correction Narrative:
Email: Operation provided a corrective action plan on 02/24/2025. Staff that incorrectly administered medication has been placed on supervised medication administration until end of March 2025. Team leader, program or campus manager or nurse will supervise this staff member during medication duties. All staff will be provided with additional medication management training. Staff on duty and responsible for medication error will meet with nurse within 24 hours to discuss error and complete report/documentation. The error report will be completed before staff leaves shift. 

Inspection: An inspection was completed at the operation on 03/19/2025. One staff and one child was interviewed and medication logs were reviewed. No concerns were found during this inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation completed a preliminary service plan four days after admitting a child in care.
Correction Narrative:
Email: On 03/07/2025 the operation provided a corrective action plan by email. Operation states that in the future the clinical team will gather to assess if there are any service plans coming due over a holiday time, long weekend, or any period where the clinical team might be away from the Family Resource and Counseling Center for several days. During these times there is always a clinician on-call. The corrective action will be that should a service plan be due while they are off it will be assigned to the on-call clinician to come in and do it or complete it via telehealth making sure all service plans are completed on time. 

Inspection: A follow-up inspection was completed at the operation on 03/19/2025. One staff member and one child were interviewed. No concerns were found during the inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple children in care allege the same staff uses profane language with them and that staff claimed there may have been times when the children in care overheard such language.
Correction Narrative:
Email: On 03/07/2025 the operation provided a corrective action plan by email. Operation states that they will include the following topics in staff meeting agenda: a. Supervisor will work directly with the Team on different trauma informed therapeutic TBRI approaches to embrace other than foul language. B. Utilize BSS Team meetings to discuss concerns, approaches, and support to continue growing as a team and provide the mentoring skills and leadership   qualities this position requires for keep children and staff safe in a non-violent environment. C. A clear understanding of the Mission and Core Values of RMYA will be reenforced at each meeting, such as Protection, Responsibility, Community, and Integrity. Helping the Team to understand these are values that they should always reflect as they live out the Mission of RMYA to break the circle of abuse.

Inspection: A follow-up inspection was completed at the operation on 03/19/2025. One staff member and one child were interviewed. No concerns were found during the inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff who was not authorized to use emergency behavior interventions due to not completing training was involved in demonstrating behavior intervention techniques with another staff which should never be used unless in an emergency situation.
Correction Narrative:
Our corrective action is as follows:
1)	The Training Director has sent out an email to all instructors informing them that at the start of each HWC training class and through the session, instructors will mention to trainees that they are only to practice holds with an approved instructor at all times. That they are not to practice on children or in the sight of children. Director of Training sent an email to all Handle with Care Instructors on 03/28/24. 	We never practice HWC with residents. Practicing HWC techniques is only done with colleagues, and preferably, with a HWC instructor present.
 We never allow the residents to see a HWC class or us as staff practicing HWC


2) The team leader on each shift will make it a part of shift change to inform new staff doing training shifts that they may not touch a child until they have been through pre-service and completed their HWC training. That this will only take place when they have been approved to be in ratio on shift and only in the case of a child wanting to harm others or self. They will record this in their shift change notes.

Deficiency Narrative: The provided Annual Summary Log was missing entries for unauthorized absences occurring in March 2023 and did not contain all required information noted in 748.453 (a) (1-6).
Correction Narrative: A compliance response was received from the operation on 12/12/2023. Operation stated that they have created a new spreadsheet to track information on runaways. They will use this spreadsheet as a log of their runaways throughout the year.

Deficiency Narrative: Child in care was given the wrong medication in error.
Correction Narrative:
On 10/10/2023 a follow-up inspection was completed at the operation. Administrator was present and provided a follow-up plan. Training regarding medication administration was provided to all staff members. Training log was provided by the operation. Staff member that involved in the incident was put on a corrective action plan and provided with additional training. 

Administrative review of this deficiency was waived by the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: Identified high risk behaviors do not include plan to address the risk for child in care.
Correction Narrative: Identified high risk behaviors do not include plan to address the risk for child in care.

Deficiency Narrative: During the review of a child s medication record it was notice that the child did not receive their  PM dose of medication as prescribed.
Correction Narrative:
Email received from operation on March 16,2022. In regards to inspection conducted by Heightened Monitoring Inspector on March 7,2022. 
Response:
In response to Administrative Rules or Minimum Standard rules which were inspected on 03/07/22:
Others: 748.2003(b)(5)
 
Our response: 
The following has been re-implemented: 
1.The supervisors on shift at the Bridge Emergency shelter, in addition to double counting medication before administration, will ask for another staff member to be present when prepping medication.  This will allow for uninterrupted time and focus on the medication administration. 
2.The Shelter's Program Administrator will assign triple counting to the overnight staff.
3.This was discussed amongst the leadership team on 03/08/22.  
In addition to this, the employee who failed to administer the medication was also disciplined.

Deficiency Narrative: Two child files reviewed did not contain vaccination records.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation with the missing immunization reports attached. The operation will continue to complete quarterly audits to catch any issues with record keeping.

Deficiency Narrative: Serious incident report was not updated with additional information.
Correction Narrative:
Standard: 748.311 Serious Incident Documentation-Documented in written report. (Weight: Medium)
Specifics:  Serious incident report was not updated with additional information.
Response: RMYA seeks to maintain a level of the highest professional quality.  In doing so, pertinent information on an employee involved in a serious incident will be kept separate.  The needed information will be kept in a section of the HM monitoring binder.

Deficiency Narrative: 4 hours of EBI training was not completed within the 180 day of last completed EBI training.
Correction Narrative:
Staff member completed two EBI training classes since inspection, each being 2 hours long.  Inspector formed completion at HM inspection by reviewing the class sign in sheets and certifications.   
Standard: 748.931(a)(1)(B)(iii) Annual Training-Every 6 months a caregiver must complete at least 4 hours of training in EBI. (Weight: Medium High)
Specifics:  4 hours of EBI training was not completed within the 180 day of last completed EBI training.
Response: The employee in question completed the 2 hours of EBI training on 10/07/2021 and will complete 2 more hours on 10/28/21.  The Program Administrator should check their staffs training monthly to ensure they are on track for their training hours, and up-to-date with all pre-service/90 day/bi-annual/annual training requirements.  Handle with Care training (verbal de-escalation, self-defense, and personal restraint techniques) is essential training to maintain a safe environment at our programs. Sign in sheets/certificates for training on 10/07 and 10/28 will be turned in to HM Monitor the following visit during the week of 11/01/21.

Deficiency Narrative: First Aid and CPR training was completed 22 days after the required date.
Correction Narrative:
Standard: 748.881(7) 748.981(c) First-aid-CPR training-Any new caregiver not currently certified in first-aid must be trained and certified within 90 days of employment (Weight: Medium High)
Specifics:  First Aid and CPR training was completed 22 days after the required date.
Response: RMYA seeks to provide services for youth that are of the highest professional quality.  In order to ensure this Pre-service training has been extended to a 7-day training to ensure the needed training is covered.

Deficiency Narrative:
The required normalcy training was not completed during pre service train
ing.
Correction Narrative:
Standard: 748.881(7) General pre-service training curriculum-Includes normalcy. (Weight: Medium) 
Specifics:  The required normalcy training was not completed during pre-service training.
Response: The topics covered in pre-service, including Normalcy, are covered in pre-service training.  The Program Administrator will ensure their employee files have the needed certificate(s).  The Training Director will ensure the training obtained in pre-service are documented with a certificate(s).  The employees monitored file has a certificate in place.   Pre-service training has been extended to a 7-day training to ensure the needed training is covered.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member failed to return a child to the operation and instead transported the child to a different location.
Correction Narrative: The operation responded to the deficiency by stating that staff who receive information on runaways must report to their supervisors. A staff member is obligated to report this information even if a runaway makes contact with a staff member outside of their working hours. The incident in question and corresponding citation will be reviewed with all Bridge staff on December 16, 2021 and agency wide from December 14th through December 15th.

Deficiency Narrative: EBI training was completed 9 months a part which does not meet the required every 180 day timeframe.
Correction Narrative: Administrators have been asked to run a bi-weekly training report to align with staff scheduling (to ensure staff availability to attending trainings), as well as a monthly training reports.

Deficiency Narrative: A refrigerator observed in the kitchen was at 44  degrees farenheit.
Correction Narrative:
A refrigerator observed in the kitchen was at 44  degrees farenheit. 

Standard was evaluated and found to be compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member was found to have conducted an inappropriate physical intervention on a child in care as well as making demeaning comments to the child. Another staff member witnessed the inappropriate physical intervention and failed to intervene to stop or de-escalate the situation.
Correction Narrative: Follow up was received from operation. On July 08, 2021 minimum standards regarding children's rights was discussed in a staff meeting. Issues regarding demeaning comments will be addressed in agency-wide staff meetings during week of July 13th through 15th. Employees will also review policy and procedures on behavior intervention, specifically authorized restraint techniques. This will be addressed in an agency wide meeting during the week of April 13th through 15th. The employee involved in the incident was immediately placed on administrative leave. The employee has since resigned from the operation. An administrative review was requested by the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: Video footage shows staff run out to chase a child and left behind two children unattended.
Correction Narrative: A response to the investigation was received from the operation. Policies and procedures will be reviewed in a staff meeting on 08/03/2021- 08/04/2021 with a focus on remaining calm.

Deficiency Narrative: Video footage provided shows a staff member placed a child in an inappropriate restraint.  The staff member is seen placing their arms underneath the child's armpits and brings their hands behind the child's head. They are also seen lifting the child slightly off the ground to walk them to the door as the child is restrained.
Correction Narrative: A response to the investigation was received from the operation. The operation will review EBI procedures to ensure compliance with standards. Additionally, the employee involved is on administrative leave and if they return they will be given an assignment within the guidelines of the provisional status.

Deficiency Narrative: While reviewing the EBI reports, there is no documentation stating that the reports were reviewed by the supervisor with in 72 hours.
Correction Narrative: Standard evaluated and found to be compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk thru it was found that the freezer temperature was 11 degrees.
Correction Narrative: Standard reviewed and found to be compliant.
